intro: Senecio pittieri, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits known as cypsela. Senecio pittieri is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, arid conditions.
